summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020, primarily between FBI personnel, regarding an external tip about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The tip, from an individual named Ugboma, claims to have information about Epstein/Maxwell assets and operations in the UK and suggests specific US sites near Teterboro Airport for investigation. The emails show the tip being forwarded internally within the FBI for review by the case agents.

persons.name: Ugboma
persons.context: External individual who contacted an FBI agent (Frank) claiming to have information about Epstein and Maxwell's assets and operations, particularly in the UK. Sent a PDF file as evidence.

persons.name: Frank
persons.context: An FBI agent who was interviewed by a British media firm about fraud investigations. He was subsequently contacted by Ugboma and asked for the tip to be forwarded to the Epstein/Maxwell case agents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case. The email tip claims there is more to his story, with assets and an operational base in the UK.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Central figure in the case. The email tip claims there is more to her story, with assets and an operational base in the UK, and suggests she may have conspired with Epstein to leave a trail of their exploits.

persons.name: Damien McDonnell
persons.role: Director (Faraday Education Limited), former Head of D.E.R.A. and D.A.A.
persons.context: Named as a director of 'Faraday Education Limited' in the UK, a company the tipster claims was misclassified and has links to the Epstein/Maxwell network. He is a former head of UK Ministry of Defence directorates.

persons.name: Rilwanu Lukman
persons.context: Mentioned as the Nigerian Minister of Petroleum in 2009 when the company 'Faraday Education Limited' was allegedly set up to liaise with the Nigerian Ministry of Petroleum's P.T.D.F. scheme.

connections.description: Described as potentially conspiring together to leave a trail of their exploits and associations in the public domain.
Implied connection through McDonnell's directorship of 'Faraday Education Limited', which the tipster links to the Epstein/Maxwell network.
Implied connection through McDonnell's directorship of 'Faraday Education Limited', which the tipster links to the Epstein/Maxwell network.
Ugboma contacted Frank after seeing his media interview. Frank then facilitated forwarding Ugboma's information to the Epstein/Maxwell case agents.

events.title: Ugboma's Initial Email Tip
events.description: Ugboma sends an email with a PDF attachment titled 'PDF Photos 2020-09-03.pdf' to an FBI contact, claiming to have evidence about Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Internal FBI Email Forwarding
events.description: Multiple internal FBI emails are exchanged forwarding Ugboma's tip for review by the Epstein/Maxwell case agents, with agents noting the content looks odd or like 'jibberish' but passing it along due to the subject matter.

events.title: Establishment of Faraday Education Limited
events.description: The company 'Faraday Education Limited' is set up in the UK. The tipster claims it was actually established to liaise with the Nigerian Ministry of Petroleum's P.T.D.F. scheme, not for 'Pre-primary Education' as listed.

locations: Mt Pleasant, SC 29465 (mailing/office address of Quick Group, LLC)
Florida (Orlando) (mentioned as a potential travel destination)
keyFacts: An external tipster named Ugboma contacted the FBI in September 2020 claiming to have significant information about Epstein and Maxwell's assets and operational bases, with a focus on over forty sites in the UK.
The tip specifically suggests that one or two US sites near Teterboro Airport and their proprietors require thorough investigation.

The tip references 'Faraday Education Limited', a UK company with director Damien McDonnell (OBE), claiming it was misclassified and has links to the Epstein/Maxwell network and Nigerian oil interests.
The email chain shows FBI agents internally forwarding the tip for review by the Epstein/Maxwell case agents, with some skepticism about its validity ('jibberish', 'looks odd').
The tipster asserts that either Epstein, Maxwell, or both conspired to leave a public trail of their exploits and associations, though the motive is unclear.
